page.title: 08FARMING THE SEA IN ASSYNT
page.content: This is the single most important aspect around which Assynt exists. The Fishing Industry began in 1948, encouraged by the late Hector Mackay. Today around 50 boats use the port & 31 local people are employed there. "Quality" fish are landed here such as Halibut, Turbot, & Skate. The fish is transported to other markets in England, before processing & finding its way onto the world markets. Several types of boats fish out of the port. Most of the boats are East coast based. With an annual turnover of some Â£5m, fleet servicing facilities have grown up. The local shops depend on their trade & a new trunk road to Ullapool was built 10 years ago to help in transporting the produce. After a difficult few years, the future for Fishing here is beginning to look promising.
